dialogues.speaker: CREASY
dialogues.text: Watches her, satisfied with what he's done. Pinta hauls herself out of the water and runs. A beeline for Creasy. And the poor fucker doesn't even understand, until she's leaping the last few feet... Into his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won, Creasy! I won! She loves him...   Creasy hugs her.   He loves her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MARIACHI BAND roams. We see Creasy but not who he's with. A date? As we come around it's Pinta. Sitting with them, Rayburn and his wife. And a sleeping four- year-old. NOTE: Rethink following dialogue with reference to Creasy / Rayburn background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Dad said all your friends were dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All but one. The most important one. When we were eighteen, we made an agreement to "take the world" together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then one day, he calls and says, 'I'm in love and I'm moving to Mexico.' I said what happened to the plan? Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said the plan was right here. Rayburn looks at beautiful 19-year-old Alicia and their four-year-old son sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hung up on him. When I met Alicia, I got it. Alicia blows Creasy a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I kiss her now, or after you've gone to bed? Laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I think now is as good as time as any. She takes out a velvet pouch from her pocket. She holds it out to Creasy. He looks at her, takes it from her hand. His thick fingers fumble with a delicate drawstring. Pinta waits for his reaction as Creasy pours a simple, but fine MEDALLION and chain into the palm of his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bought it with my own money.     I saved it. Creasy is really affected, tries to hide it.    She takes it, slips it over his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's St. Jude, the patron saint of lost causes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And hard cases. Creasy's the reason St. Jude became a Saint in the first place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's right. Creasy looks at it, considers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Pinta, it's beautiful. Work in Progress 2/10/03 Pinta kisses him. As the Mariachi band drifts over, Rayburn grabs his wife by the hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, baby. I feel like a third wheel. Watch the kid. They dance. A waiter steps over, refills Creasy's water glass. As he drinks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I ask you a question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I stop you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't drink like you used to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not a question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know because I go in your room and check the bottles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still not a question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mom drinks, too...    Why do people drink, Creasy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that's a question. I don't know about your Mom. For me, the problem isn't in the glass. The problem's in between my ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think too much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Because at one time, I didn't think enough. Pinta nods, thinks she understands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samuel and Lisa on the moving escalator. Home from Los Angeles. They look down through the glass, see Creasy waiting for them below. And finally, Lisa frowns. Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has to go, Samuel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?    You were so pleased with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinta likes him too much. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She thinks of him as a father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not. Samuel thinks about it, is almost apologetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've just been so busy, Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has to go. Samuel looks at her, wonders at her adamancy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three month trial ends in a week. I just won't confirm the position. That possibility was understood when I hired him. Lisa gives him a look. She wants it done today.     But f once, Samuel is stronger than his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't create bad feelings. And another week won't make a difference. Off the escalator, they turn toward Creasy waiting unaware.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will be a hard break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's young.     She'll get over it. Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't thinking of Pinta. As Lisa looks over at Samuel, he's reaching out his hand, smiling big.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creasy, how are you? As they shake hands...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to play piano!   I want to swim!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No discussion, Pinta. Mr. Lozzi is a famous teacher. If he accepts you, you will play. As Pinta marches out of the room...

dialogues.speaker: EXT. RAMOS VILLA- DAY
dialogues.text: The sounds of Samuel's baby grand resonates throughout the villa. An impassioned rendering of a Mozart symphony. Pinta is looking for Frank. Today is Saturday and on weekends Frank is allowed to travel with them. And today she is claiming all her rights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank.   Frankie. Pinta whistles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinta, we've got to go.   Travel sucks at this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank.   Frankie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creasy driving.   Pinta looking noble and brave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's strange. Frank was a no-show. Not like him to miss a ride. Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should break all my fingers, Creasy, then tape them back together. I won't be able to play the piano, but I could still swim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be a baby. You're tougher than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no such thing as tough, Creasy. Just trained and untrained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then be trained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to keep people safe someday. Just like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be a swimmer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could do it. Remember the day   you wanted the pencil? I know why.    And I saw that car again. I wrote the   license number in my notebook. Except I   missed the last number. Creasy checks his mirror, nothing back there now.     He then looks at Pinta. A bit amazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to show me that number when we get home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wide avenue. The Mercedes pulls up parks in the only open spot. Creasy and Pinta get out. We walks her across the street, along the lawn to the apartment building. They look up at the sound of piano keys tinkling above. Then: Creasy looks at her, smiles to himself.   Pinta looks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Continue to play in the wrong key, like you're dyslexic. Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dyslexic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like St. Jude. A hopeless case that has a complete block about 'C' Minor. But remember, "Whoever resists authority will bring judgement upon themselves." New Testament, Romans 13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got that right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be back in the water in twenty- four hours. Creasy presses the buzzer. As they wait, Pinta sees something, reaches down to pull a DANDELION from a crack where the sidewalk meets the wall. She smiles at Creasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For you, Creasy. Creasy takes it from her. He's saved by the bell as a second buzzer answers the first. Creasy pulls the door open. Pinta heaves a resigned sigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember 'dyslexic.' As Pinta nods, disappears inside...

dialogues.speaker: 2ND FLOOR WINDOW
dialogues.text: The curtains rustle in the breeze. The sound of badly played scales. And then sounds of frustration. Then, the sound of the teacher playing.   Pinta appears i the window for just a moment.

dialogues.speaker: CREASY
dialogues.text: Looking up from the window of the Mercedes. As Pinta is called back inside, Creasy checks out, twirls the dandelion Pinta gave him. HUMS to himself. "Blue Bayou."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: THE STREET
dialogues.text: Creasy leaning against the Mercedes. Traffic pounding by. The dandelion is stuck in a button hole of his shirt. And then suddenly traffic thins out. Reminiscent of the previous two kidnappings. It's a process. Creasy straightens up. A Judicial POLICE CAR cruises by, slowly. Creasy makes eye contact with the two cops up front. The same guys who were at Zona Rosa. Creasy starts across the street toward the apartment building. At the same time as... The door bangs open. Pinta exiting. She spots Creasy, a huge grin on her face. She was not accepted. And a white TOYOTA COROLLA coming the other way. The police car reverses back, cutting Creasy off from Pinta. The COPS getting out, big smiles on their faces.

dialogues.speaker: THE COROLLA
dialogues.text: Slides to a stop in front of Pinta, blocking her path to Creasy. And as TWO MEN leap out from the backseat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (drawing his 9mm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run, Pinta, run! But she's rooted with fear. And the men are almost on her. Creasy raises the 9mm overhead.    BANG! And the sound frees her.   Pinta runs! Ducking under a flailing arm.    Quick and lithe.   Tryin to reach her bodyguard. The cops drawing Uzi's.. Creasy plants himself, the Sig Sauer now level.     He fi twice into COP ONE, dead center in the chest. Pinta runs.   Chased by the TWO MEN. COP TWO returns fire wildly: the Mercedes hit in a ten bullet line. Work in Progress 2/10/03 Creasy fires two more rounds into COP TWO who's hit high in the chest and throat. Precise. Creasy pivots, strides calmly forward, firing at the men chasing Pinta. BOOM! BOOM! BOOM! MAN ONE goes down, hit in the ribs. A bullet slams Creasy in the back, fired from inside the Corolla. Creasy fires back.    BOOM!    BOOM! MAN THREE falls dead, hit just below his nose, just above his teeth. The FAT DRIVER fires, now, and Creasy is hit in the shoulder. And Pinta disappears into the traffic.        Gone. MAN TWO, who has abandoned chasing Pinta, fires again. Creasy drops the 9mm as he is hit in the stomach.      He falls to his knees. The dandelion starts to come apart.      Drifting away, p by piece. Slack-jawed, Creasy looks about. Sees the FAT DRIVER heaving himself out of the Corolla while MAN TWO scans for Pinta who's nowhere in sight. She got away!   Creasy smiles even as he crumples over on his side.

dialogues.speaker: CREASY
dialogues.text: And Pinta is back. Running toward Creasy. She can't leave him like this. She was safe and now she's back.

dialogues.speaker: NOOO...
dialogues.text: She runs to him, wraps her arms around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creasy... MAN TWO catches up, tears Pinta away, starts back for the sedan. Creasy can only blink after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creasy! Work in Progress 2/10/03 It's not a cry for help.     It's anguish for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinta... MAN TWO crams her in the back seat, follows. The fat driver gets back in behind the wheel. As the door slams shut, wheels spin, grip and the Corolla accelerates away. We just see Pinta look back through the rear windshield. An anguished image before she's pulled back down. Creasy makes a wish.     Not for himself, but for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't die, Creasy, don't die. And everything goes very, very,

dialogues.speaker: BLACK
dialogues.text: Sound breaks through first. The whir and beep of medical equipment. And we fade back into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creasy hooked up. Tubes running in and out of the unconscious man. And he's suddenly surrounded. The CHIEF of the Judicial Police and several uniformed OFFICERS. At the foot of the bed several NEWSPAPER REPORTERS and PHOTOGRAPHERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This man, Senor Robert Creasy, an American citizen, is under arrest for the murder of two police officers, Hector Gonzalez and Pablo Lunara. He is also the prime suspect in the kidnapping of Pinta Martin Ramos. One of the officers props up Creasy's head.     The chief puffs his chest out and flashes flash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds of a DOG BARKING Bruno opens the door to a very distraught Frank.     Some had locked him in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Sitting catatonic. In the dark. Halfway to mourning already. A HUBBUB drifts up from the rooms below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bedraggled-looking Samuel sits with Jordan by the phone. An INSURANCE COMPANY LAWYER is here as well. Maria cries softly in a doorway. MONTAGE - of chaos and panic. Judicial police are trying to set up shop. Tape recorders. Listening devices. Video cameras.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did he say he would call back? Cut to Do not tell them you have a kidnap policy. Cut to They usually ask for three times the amount they expect... They react as two vehicles pull up outside. Chaos as the front door opens. MEN IN SUITS, several POLICEMEN. Their very well-groomed leader is COLONEL TAZINARI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senor Ramos. I am Ernesto Tazinari, commandante of the Judicial anti- kidnapping division.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do not need or want police involvement. I am the negotiator. We feel a better guarantee of getting Pinta back without your involvement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a written order from the Public Ministry. Two police officers were killed. (he holds up the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the Attorney General Navarro Bernal Diaz. Jordan accepts reality.    They're taking control. Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The law requires an intervention by the authorities "de officio." A ringing phone sounds like an bomb exploding in the room. A technician answers. Jordan takes the receiver. We hear the conversation. The kidnapper only wants to talk to the father. Everybody is one headsets, monitoring. Samuel listens carefully. Jordan prompts him with hand-written replies on a notepad. Samuel negotiates the amount via notes from his lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's impossible. I cannot afford thirty million. I will need to borrow the money. Samuel proposes five million.   Kidnapper gets angry. Demands 20 million.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The realities are I do not have access to this type of money. They settle at ten million.   The kidnapper gives a list of instructions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two and a half million in two different bags. The bags you can get from Save-On. Fifteen gallon, black canvas, divide the money equally. Samuel is on another phone talking to family friends asking if they will front a hundred thousand dollars each. Which will be paid back by the K & R insurance 45 days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I will give you interest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will instruct you on the exchange over the next 24 hours. Work in Progress 2/10/03 Lisa is nowhere to be found.   Locked in her bedroom in darkness with Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another showcase press conference.     More REPORTERS and now TV NEWS CREWS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl is a Mexican citizen. Her father is Samuel Valencia Ramos.

dialogues.speaker: CONFERENCE
dialogues.text: Rosanna, the woman we saw on T.V. earlier, stands watching and listening. Incredulous and angry. MIGUEL MANZANO the Director of AFI (also seen earlier on TV), approaches with his two assistants and kisses Rosanna on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bodyguard was shot trying to protect a 9 year old. The bodyguard's American. Not only that he's black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that good or bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good. Really good. He shot and killed two judicial cops and a kidnapper died in the attack. They're saying he's responsible. Manzano looks bemused, as he eats a sugary pastry. Rosanna heads into the press conference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beside the American in custody, are any other Americans involved in the kidnapping?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're looking into it. Rosanna can't believe what she's hearing. Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two officers who were killed. Records show they were off duty at the time. The Chief frowns at the sight of Rosanna, knows what a royal pain in the ass she is. Manzano awaits his answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure.     All I know is they died bravely. He turns, points out another reporter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they were off duty, why were they in a patrol car? What exactly were they doing at the scene of a kidnapping? He stares back over at her, furious.     Rosanna smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were they known for their exceptional good luck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were known for their professionalism and integrity!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It opens and out slides Rayburn. He looks down the hallway. Press conference is still going down that way. Rayburn heads the other way. But as he tries to enter Creasy's room, he's met in the door by TWO THUG COPS, in uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No visitors. Cop two pokes a finger into Rayburn's chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here to see my friend. Cop two pokes him again.     Goading him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Identification. Work in Progress 2/10/03 Rayburn swallows his anger, starts fishing for his wallet. Suddenly, the thugs snap to attention. Manzano is on the way down followed by ADJUTANT and TWO PLAINCLOTHES. Ignoring the proffered salutes, Manzano finishes his pastry, licks his fingertips as he regards Rayburn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I heard it was this hospital I was so pleased. There's a pastry shop nearby. Delgado's. Do you know it? Rayburn shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The best pastries in Mexico. Manzano holds out his right hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miguel Manzano.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creasy out of it still.    Rayburn and Manzano at the foo of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not a cop killer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure he isn't. Though he's certainly adept at killing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was doing his job, protecting the girl. If police were involved, you figure it out. I'm here for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So am I. And Creasy stirs.   Rayburn leans into his friend, Manzan just behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear me, Crease? Creasy's eyes slit open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got three of the fuckers.   All dead. Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinta...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two days gone. They're negotiating a ransom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These things take time, Mr. Creasy. Creasy closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Technicians, police, Tazinari, Jordan, and Samuel all listen intently to the call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK,repeat the drop instructions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The money, 10 million U.S. will be divided into two 15 gallon black canvas bags each containing five million which will be checked at the bank by the K&R agent. Then driven to the house in an armored car where it will be transferred to the delivery car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car will not be powerful and have no trunk. Intercut the above with real time visuals illustrating the process: 1. INT. BANK    Teller counting the money witnessed by K& agent. 2. EXT. BANK Two bags being loaded into the armored car. K&R agent watching. 3. EXT. RAMOS HOUSE - DRIVEWAY Two bags being transferred to the family Mercedes. The K&R agent notices the Mercedes has a flat tire. second Mercedes is exchanged for the first. Work in Progress 2/10/03 The two bags are transferred inside the garage. Jordan supervises the transfer while the K&R agent takes an incoming call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The call between The Voice and Jordan continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a driver to drive Samuel, the father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.    Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has a heart condition.     Angina.   He responds badly to stress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. You will arrive at Columbus Circle and Reforma Avenue at 3AM. You will drive around the square two times. Samuel will remove his shirt and hold it out the window to I.D. the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The delivery car with a white shirt held out of the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a payphone     on the Southeast corner. The phone      will ring. You will answer and wait for     instruction. Samuel exits the car and goes to the payphone.      The p is ringing. Samuel picks it up and listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need proof of life. PAUSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is the father, there? Jordan hands the phone to Samuel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this girl's life  is as important to you as it is to me,  do not play with the process. Family is   everything. I am a professional. You   keep your word and I will keep mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creasy being wheeled down the hall by a tough plain- clothed Federal Policeman. Followed by Rayburn, Manzano, and Rosanna. The uniformed JUDICIAL POLICE are powerless to stop them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the deal here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't gamble leaving him here. These guys will kill him in a heartbeat 'while trying to stop him from escaping.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samuel driving.   Tazinari dialing his cellphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said no phones!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do your job. I'll do mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samuel's car is parked on the  south side of the bridge. A shirtless Samuel carries two  large duffle bags containing ten million dollars  across the bridge. We see Tazinari again dialing up his  cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave the money in the trunk of the car with white paper taped to the windshield, then return to your car and go home. Do not look back. Samuel finds the car, leaves the bag in the trunk, he turns and heads back over the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember, I am a professional. If you keep your word, I will keep mine. If you do not, then God be with your child. Work in Progress 2/10/03 As Samuel is walking back across the bridge. Suddenly gunfire from where he came, along with shouting and yelling. Samuel crouches and runs in the dark back to his car with Tazinari.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cages of mangy looking mutts. Pull back to reveal Creasy on his hospital bed, IVs and all. Rayburn sits nearby. He looks up as Creasy stirs, wakes again. Creasy's eyes flicker to his friend, ask the first question on his mind. Pinta... Rayburn looks away, can't face his friend.   And suddenly Creasy knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's dead.   Isn't she? Rayburn finally nods. And with that gesture, God takes everything away. It might as well be the Old Testament. And we are about to get Biblical. Creasy turns his head, looks up at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a fuck up. Someone hijacked the drop. The kidnapper, his nephew got killed. CU of Creasy's face with his back to the room.     A thousand yard stare. His eyes glaze over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU of Pinta looking up at Creasy. The camera ramps into Pinta's smile. A small, but a sinificant moment in terms of their connection. INT. LISA & SAMUEL'S BEDROOM - DAY The curtains are drawn tight. Slivers of light illuminate the darkened room. Lisa sits on the end of the bed humming a nursery rhyme. She rocks gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You betrayed me. You killed my nephew and took the money. K&R AGENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not us...No we did not. Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember my words. Family is everything and do not play with the process. The phone line goes dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creasy still staring into space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's dead Creasy. Creasy blinks away a solitary tear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dogs barking constantly. Manzano walks the hall flanked by a DOCTOR and a NURSE. A second policeman, Manzano's adjutant, brings up the rear carrying two heavy binders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's dead. They fucked with 'the process' and his nephew died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He suffered gunshot   wounds to the upper extremity, chest and   abdomen. He has a collapsed lung which   is stabilized, injured his spleen,   which we may have to remove and ruptured   his intestine. He's on strict bedrest or   there's a good chance we could lose   him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A strange man. He has much experience of hospitals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he say so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   But a nurse knows.

dialogues.speaker: MUGSHOT
dialogues.text: Manzano and the adjutant have pulled chairs up alongside the bed. The adjutant flips through one of the binders. Each page holds a single MUGSHOT. Each time Creasy shakes his head, the adjutant flips to the next photo. Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing? Creasy shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent work by the way. Three men dead. Only ten rounds fired. Creasy shakes his head at the next shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If two of the men in my division could shoot like that, I could get rid of the other thirty-six. One of the dogs starts to bark. Another. Soon ten of them. The VET ASSISTANT enters, shouts at them to quiet. Manzano ignores it, motions the adjutant to flip pages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe it or not, you're safe here. The Judicial police will kill you. If they can. (re: book)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This page?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. The adjutant reaches the last page.   Creasy shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a rather checkered past. Mr. Creasy. Your Interpol file is six pages long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I a suspect?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   It would be convenient, but no. As Manzano packs up his mugshot books...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me mugshots of Mexican policemen. Maybe then we'll get somewhere. Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All these photos you just saw were of policemen. Sadly they're protected. La Hermanidad. The brotherhood. Manzano heads off.   As Creasy watches after him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creasy sitting on the gurney, Rayburn buttons his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay? Creasy nods. Rayburn gets Creasy's arm over his shoulder, eases him off the gurney till his feet hit the floor. Creasy winces, but the two of them start to walk out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An SUV rolling away. Lights out, engine off. It coasts a hundred yards before the engine turns over. Rayburn behind the wheel. As it sweeps past camera...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rayburn constantly checking the rear view.   No pursuit i sight. He looks over at Creasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you feel? Creasy looks over at him, finally shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stomach's gone. But... okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get you up to the border. Friend of mine'll take you in to San Diego. Drop you right at the hospital. Creasy's not really listening. He's been looking in the passenger side view mirror. Nothing back there. Creasy sits up. A bit of an effort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a thing I gotta do first. Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scene of the crime. Typical Mexican 'roadside shrines' where the policemen fell. A pyre of flowers where Pinta was scooped up, Creasy's blood still staining the sidewalk alongside. A car pulls up... Rosanna Guerrero gets out with a REPORTER and PHOTOGRAPHER. She directs them in Spanish. The reporter starts making notes; the photographer snaps photos of the shrine. Rosanna stands by the flower pyre. Something catches her eye. A balled-up piece of paper and a half-burned candle beside it. As she picks it up, she spots something else. Across the street, Creasy walks. An awkward hitch in his stride. Outside the apartment of the piano teacher, surveying the scene with experienced eyes. Unaware of Rosanna

dialogues.speaker: CREASY, (FLASHBACK)
dialogues.text: Corolla.   Muzzle flashes.    Pinta screaming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creasy... Creasy wheels.   There's Rosanna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of people are looking for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess that makes you the smart one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're interested in the same thing.         I'm writing a story. Creasy walks away from her.     Rosanna catches up and ho out a plastic ziploc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This might interest you.       I found it across the street. Creasy empties the contents of the ziplock into his hand. A small ball of paper and the remains of a black candle. Creasy unballs the paper. It's a photo. FLASH:   Creasy at the police station.      His photo tak Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Santa Muerte. Death worship. The religion of La Hermanidad. There's a curse on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a little late. He hands it back to her, not interested.    As he turns t go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do? Creasy doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can help. I have a situation Mr. Creasy. There is a brotherhood called Le Hermanidad which protects both high ranking Government officials, corrupt police, and organized crime at a level that is very difficult for me to touch. I believe you were a victim of this organization. You and this story may help to unmask them. Creasy looks carefully at Rosanna.    Right now he trusts no one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. He walks away towards Rayburn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SUV parked a discreet distance away. Rayburn grinds out another cigarette, mutters to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruno lets him in. Nothings been touched.     Creasy retrieves his bullet from his shrine along   with the 'Jack', Marlboros, and New Testament. Puts    his few possessions in a bag. MOVE WITH him as he    silently crosses out into the hall, heads toward...

dialogues.speaker: PINTA'S ROOM
dialogues.text: He stands there a moment. His pain entirely his own. And then he goes to Pinta's little desk, finds her school notebook buried in a pile. He flips through it until he finds... Work in Progress 2/10/03 The LICENSE PLATE NUMBER Pinta jotted for him. Then he notices the notebook is really a diary. Every page references her day to day relationship with Creasy. "I love you Creasy Bear." He hears soft footsteps. Creasy turns. Lisa stands in the doorway in her nightgown, her eyes drilling through Creasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You let them take her.     She loved you and you let them take her. Creasy just blinks at her as the words blast through him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you here?     Why didn't you die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because... (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was already dead. Eyes brimming, Lisa has no more words.       But Creasy c bearing cold comfort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you   to know something. (a   beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going   to kill them. Anyone who opens their eyes   at me. Lisa doesn't answer, but the connection between them is suddenly monumental. Finally, Creasy looks away. He picks up Pinta's battered, old TEDDY BEAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creasy... He turns, but she doesn't look back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill them, Creasy. Creasy nods.    He will.    As he continues away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creasy exits the house and stands by the pool. Frank appears tail wagging and attempts to comfort Creasy. Work in Progress 2/10/03 Leaves blow across the surface of the water. Underwater slow motion, a wall turn. It looks remarkably like Pinta. "Blue Bayou" drifts through the air. Soft, in the ether somewhere. Creasy hears it, half raises his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why Blue Bayou, Creasy? Is that where you're from? She's standing behind him. Wearing the all too familiar one piece swimsuit, she towels her wet hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Bayou is a dream, Pinta.     Like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dreams are beautiful, Creasy-Bear, but life is better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to watch you now.

dialogues.speaker: CREASY
dialogues.text: The words are a salve, a balm.     He turns, looks back o his shoulder. He's all alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rayburn looks over his shoulder, sees Creasy walking down the street. Clutching a teddy bear. Creasy gets in the car.    Rayburn drives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be Stateside by suppertime. No answer.   Finally, as Rayburn lights a cigarette...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to need help, Ray. Rayburn grinds out the cigarette he just lit, knows what just was asked. Creasy needs help unleashing a plague. Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck. Look at you; you won't last a day the shape you're in. Unless you stop bleeding you should have your spleen removed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes or no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't kill again. Hunt people. I gave that up. Anything else? It's yours. Creasy reaches into a pocket, hands Rayburn a hand written list. Rayburn reads, his eyes widening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Creasy. You're talking war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The surface breaks as Creasy enters the water     wearing red T-shirt to hide the bandages. He begins      a slow laborious stroke.  A pale attempt at getting     back int shape. A ribbon of  maroon trails him through     the wat

dialogues.speaker: LOCATION
dialogues.text: Fluorescents flicker on. A Fiat up on the hydraulic lift. A section of the garage is portioned off by heavy steel sheeting with a padlocked door. One of the two men unlocks it.      Creasy and Rayburn en

dialogues.speaker: PARTITION
dialogues.text: Three long steel tables.    Covered with weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candy store. Every town in Mexico has one if you know what door to bang on. Creasy stops by the pistols.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take the .45 and the Webley .32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it's old fashioned, but it's reliable. Like us. Work in Progress 2/10/03 Next he's looking at grenades.   He hefts two different choices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need less than standard packing. Can you knock up a case for fifteen of each? He picks up a double barrel shotgun, checks the line of it. He flicks open the breach, snaps it shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut the stock here. The barrel here. Make sure you file it smooth. (looks around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket launchers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Different door. Not far from here. JUMP CUTS of the following being loaded into a bag: .45 Colt, ammo, clips, bodyarmor (the kind you wear under your clothing), nightvision scope, a couple of flash-bang grenades, flex-cuffs, a silent 9mm Beretta, a small shotgun, pepper spray, and four cellphones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosanna picks up phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creasy holding the card Rosanna gave him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I can help your situation and you mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where do we begin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need the name and address of the owner of a Toyota Corolla, license number ME31704...We didn't get the last digit so I need the ten possible matches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do I get in return? Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see how the relationship develops. I'll call you in the AM. Thanks. Creasy hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manzano, Rosanna, and technicians are listening to voice analysis tapes of various kidnappers. They're struggling. Rosanna hands the piece of paper with the license plate number to Manzano.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll die of his wounds; bleed to death before he can do anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sounded strong to me.      Stronger than we are. Rosanna pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he's outside. Because he's not tied to the same system we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did voice analysis of the last five high profile kidnappings, including the little girl. The same man 'The Dreamer'. Listen to this. Manzano plays back a recording of the Kidnapper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I used to run through the streets of Neza because I was scared of being fucked with. I swore one day I would cross the street walking. Now I walk."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's protected by La Hermanidad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know this.    Your point?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creasy is not a policeman. My sense is he could be very valuable to us. Rosanna waits for a response.    None. Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what do you have to lose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a moral issue. On one hand you're cleaning up the bad guys, but in another way we are feeding the problem that produces bad guys. Finally deciding, Manzano turns, holds out his hand. Rosanna hands him the paper with the partial license written on it.,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JORGE RAMIREZ, the 350 lb. driver who shot Creasy in the shoulder exits. Whistling to himself, gets behind the wheel of a Fiat 500. Unaware he's being shadowed by a man on a scooter. Creasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it comes to a stop. Jorge gets out. We hear the scooter whine as Jorge crosses the street and enters a PUBLIC BUILDING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creasy watches and waits.    Time lapse of the building Jorge exits the building still trying to get the last button of his police uniform closed. He's a cop. He struggles to get behind the wheel of the Fiat. The car is tiny. Someone's getting in on the passenger side. As Jorge starts to protest, Creasy rams a Sig into his gut. At the same time, he takes Jorge's gun from its holster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know who I am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are Jorge Ramirez. Creasy jams him in the gut again. Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drive. Jorge starts the engine.    As he eases out into traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car graveyard sitting on top of a 300 foot cliff overlooking a real tough barrio. Gravel crunches under the Fiat's tires as it drives to the edge of a cliff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop here.    Turn off the ignition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jorge does as he's told. Suddenly the Sig comes down hard. WHACK! As Jorge's vision explodes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still in the driver's seat, Jorge wakes. The first thing he sees is that his hands are taped to the steering wheel with his pudgy white fingers exposed. He is naked, reminiscent of the 18 year old in the opening sequence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you hear me? Jorge nods, the pain in his head blinding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am going to ask questions. If you don't answer, fully and truthfully, you will suffer much more than you have to. Creasy opens Pinta's notebook to a blank page near the end. He clicks open a pen. Creasy presses in the car's cigarette lighter. Then he opens a buck knife.    Jorge winces at the sound the blade locking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to cut your fingers off.     One by one. If I have to. The cigarette lighter pops back out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's to cauterize the stubs. Work in Progress 2/10/03 Holy sweet Jesus... Sweat drips down Jorge's forehead. He tries to master his fear. Swallows dry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know who I am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am the President of La Hermanidad. Without warning Creasy reaches up with the buck knife, a flash of steel. The big man howls, his left ear suddenly missing, starts an epic struggle, practically breaking the wheel off the steering column. He is like a bucking Rhinoceros. He howls as Creasy sprays his face with pepper spray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The passenger side door opens and Creasy stumbles out. Some of the pepper spray has gotten in his face as well. Creasy wipes his tearing eyes. And then he turns. Hefting the knife in his hand, he marches back toward the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!   No! And then a terrible SCREAM. BLOOD squirts against the inside of the windshield. The car rocks on its shocks. And then another terrible SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: JORGE
dialogues.text: Stares at the stump of his right forefinger, smoke rising up off it. Creasy sticks the lighter back in its hole. And Creasy looking at him, devoid of emotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wh- wh- what do you want to know? It takes a moment for Creasy to come back.    He picks up the pen and notebook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ramos kidnapping.   How did it work? Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. We were just given instructions to take her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ordered by who? Jorge hesitates.   As Creasy sets the pen down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Creasy jerks back Jorge's middle finger, raises the knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a mile a minute)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know! We work in parts. A    voice calls in a kidnapping. We deliver   the target to the guardians. We don't   even know them. They might transfer to   other guardians. The negotiators and the bosses don't even see the target.   They just make the deal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who ordered it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops call him 'The Dreamer'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do I find him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs; terrified)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. No one knows.

dialogues.speaker: CREASY
dialogues.text: Scream, as the knife comes down. Creasy tosses the finger out the window, wipes some of Jorge's blood off his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I swear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm professional. I just do my job. Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too.    Tell me about the guardians.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He called me on the cell phone to set a time and location for the switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one who transferred Pinta to their car. FLASHBACKS: See Pinta being manhandled from the white Fiat to the trunk of Grand Marquis. She has been bound and taped around the mouth and eyes. Creasy looks like he'll kill him on the spot.     Muzzles his Sig into the palm of Jorge's right hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, but I know his face. Creasy cocks the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see him sometimes at the handball court in Chapultepec on a Saturday afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I recognize him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has a tattoo covering two-thirds of his back. He is part of the Brotherhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the next hour, where do I find your partner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One-one-three Arco Iris.    Third floor. Creasy closes the notebook, caps the pen.    It's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gunshot echoes over the barrio. Creasy gets out of the car, reaches back to release the emergency brake. Work in Progress 2/10/03 The Fiat 500 goes over the cliff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids playing SOCCER. One of them kicks an errant pass. It skips down the street toward an approaching Creasy. The kids shout for him to kick the ball back, but he ignores them. As the kids curse him out, Creasy enters 1- 1-3... BOOM UP alongside the building. A man steps to a third floor window... man two who stuffed Pinta into the car. His name is Sandri. And we're inside. SANDRI (Italian Immigrant) Putting his cufflinks through his shirt sleeves. Wearing a shoulder holster. A satisfied smile as he looks back into the room. At the bed. A 17-year-old GIRL under the sheet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When will I see you again? Pulling  on his suit coat, Sandri steps to the door. He mimes a  pistol action with his forefinger and thumb. He opens it  to find himself staring square into the eyes of Creasy.   He rests the twin barrels of the sawed-off shotgun  square against Sandri's chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her name was Pinta. Sandri registers the name.   Creasy swings the shotgun down to Sandri's groin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BA-BOOM.   A flock of pigeons explode out of the Jacarand trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roman's Chapter 13:21. Do not be overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good. There is no authority except from God. Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creasy swimming toward the far wall. As he rolls, kicks off, it's Pinta who emerges from the bubbles swimming back the over way. Pinta swims through the a maroon cloud filtering through the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU of Pinta's diary. Creasy opens it up. The bullet sits in the center crease. He thumbs through the pages stopping on different days. Pinta's V.O. Illustrating those pages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handball court. Intense game with big money stakes. A sea of criminal faces cheer on the gladiators from the bleachers. It's a close match. A 200 pound Guardian removes his T-shirt before serving. Turns to reveal a huge tattoo across two-thirds of his back. Creasy registers his prey.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BARRIO SUNSET
dialogues.text: A small Russian Taurus crests a hill and descends into Hell. A frightening looking Barrio. Burnt out cars and dead dogs line the sidewalks. Creasy tails the Guardian on his moped into the center of a trash dump. The focal point being a semi-derelict church within a gated compound. Our 'tattooed handball genius' exits the Taurus. Reaches in back for the groceries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A knock. GUARDIAN TWO steps over, carries a pistol.     H slides back a speakeasy slot to reveal our tattooed Guardian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hola!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guardian One stands at the slot. Creasy is pressed up against the wall out of sight. He holds the shotgun wrapped in a ragged beach towel. As the door unlocks and opens and Guardian One steps in, Creasy slides in right behind him. Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the butt of the shotgun makes contact with Guardian Two's mouth. Blood spouts as his front teeth are smashed in. As he raises his hands to his face, the pistol he holds discharges into the ceiling. Guardian One watches as Creasy clubs him again in the head. Frightened footsteps running on the other side of a plywood wall. A female voice yelling from the other room. Creasy gauges their whereabouts. BOOM!    Creasy fires into the wall.    Wall explodes. Guardian Three freezes mid stride.      It's a tough look woman in her 40's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three guardians stand facing the wall. Hands bound with tape or cuffed. Naked (like our 18 year old) other than their dirty skivvies. Creasy holds up a picture of Pinta.      An I.D. picture taken from her schoolbook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about the girl. All three look...and with a strange defiant arrogance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck's that? BOOM! BOOM!    Creasy kills Guardian One.

dialogues.speaker: THE FOLLOWING
dialogues.text: The two Guardians each bound in two different rooms. Both have their eyes taped shut. Creasy interrogates Guardian Two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does it work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything on the cellphone. We wait for calls. We have no number to call. Creasy picks a cell phone up off the table, hits redial. It's a blocked line. Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who pays you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have an ATM bank card. We draw out 300 dollars every two weeks. Creasy takes the ATM card from Guardian Two's shirt pocket as he lies on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the PIN number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The number you use at the bank machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four-seven-four-seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who killed her? You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't lie to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boss did or his brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the boss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know! We never see his face! We have to wait in the other room. He was screaming to the girl that... FLASHBACK:   Guardians POV.    Hearing the above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...his nephew was killed in the exchange. And the money was stolen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What money? Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ransom money. At the drop. He said Tazinari, one of the policemen had taken it. He was crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Tazinari?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Head of the antikidnapping division. FLASHBACK: Guardians POV.     See the wall shake from a bodily impact.. BOOM!    Creasy shoots Guardian Two. GUARDIAN THREE (Female) Becomes a panicked whirling dervish at the sound. A moment later Creasy is there. Tearing the tape off her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The white tiled room we saw Pinta held in.    The door opens and Guardian Three leads Creasy in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was screaming about the money and his dead nephew. He threw the little girl against the wall. The Female Guardian points. Creasy steps over.       Ther a smear of BLOOD against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She fell. She wasn't moving. They threw her body in the trunk of the car and drove away. FLASHBACK: Guardian's POV through window. We glimpse through a dirty window, Pinta's body being put into a car trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?   Who's they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boss's brother, I recognize his voice. It's high pitched. We call him Woody Woodpecker. Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now listen to me. If you tell me where to find the boss. I will let you live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.    I don't know. And Creasy stands there a moment. Realizes she is telling the truth. Lost. And the sound that snaps him out of it... A GIRL CRYING. And Creasy is suddenly moving down...

dialogues.speaker: THE HALLWAY
dialogues.text: After the sound.    He kicks open a door.       There! In a 8' X 4' room.       A 12-year-old GIRL.    Bound and blindfolded. FLASHCUT:   We think it's Pinta for a heartbeat, but it's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A window to the left explodes as the room is enveloped in flames. The front door opens, a weird sight. Creasy exits holding both the 12-year-old's hand and the Female Guardian who's bound and blindfolded in her underwear. They walk straight at camera as flames shoot out of the roof. Creasy has set the place on fire. Creasy is on fire. And as they continue to walk towards us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roman chapter 13:7. Therefore whoever resists authority will bring judgement on themselves. Now it is time to awake out of sleep for our salvation is nearer than we first believed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A telephone ringing.       Rosanna at her desk.    She pi the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosanna Guerrero. Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Creasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Los Arcos. Was a little girl kidnapped recently? About twelve maybe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last night.    Do you know something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was her name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camila.   Camila Valencias.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creasy on the cellphone, the small Russian Taurus in the background. He stands outside the building still holding the little girl's hand. She has the same lost look he does. Female Guardian in the back of car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camila. The girl looks up at the name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creasy hands the girl an ice cream cone. He looks over as Rosanna hurries over from across the street. Creasy puts the little girl's hand into Rosanna's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need something. Do you have banking connections?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitates, then...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have connections. Creasy hands her the ATM card. Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PIN number is 4-7-4-7.    I need to know whose account it is. Rosanna notices the blood on Creasy's shirt.    Near his stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do I find you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you tomorrow. Creasy looks at the girl and starts off, then looks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you know about the cop? Tazinari. The one who made the ransom drop with Samuel Ramos?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's an old fashioned patrone with the worst reputation. He's high on my hit list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where does he live?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lives in a Judicial Compound. He travels by motorcade. He has better protection than George Bush. Even more importantly he is part of La Hermanidad. His reach is far and wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the address.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beehive. Cops. Photos of dead kidnappers on the wall: Jorge and Sandri. Sandri emasculated, one hand missing. Jorge behind the wheel, fingers stubs and a missing ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two in one day. And they died very badly. Sandri and Jorge were prime suspects in twelve kidnappings in the last six months. Manzano studies the photo of Jorge. Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoever did this was methodical, unafraid. Was Jorge's mugshot in the photos we showed Creasy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I checked. But right   after Sandri was shot, a girlfriend of  his was found naked, hysterical in the  street. She said it was a man fitting  Creasy's description who shot him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Creasy was, and maybe is again, a very lethal human being.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't seem very surprised? Manzano looks at his Adjutant, pleased with his perception. But he isn't sharing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's surprising these days? An AFI agent brings over a plate of red shredded chicken. Manzano takes a bite, moans in pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your sister?    Only a virgin cooks like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your man's here. Interrogation room two.

dialogues.speaker: SURVEILLANCE ROOM
dialogues.text: Seen through a two-way mirror.   Manzano watches as... Rayburn sits at a steel chair, bolted to the floor. Rayburn's eyes are closed. In meditation. Then, slowly, his arms extend out to the sides. Manzano is curious as, slower still, Rayburn extends both hands out in front of him, palms up. Must be a Zen thing. Then, both MIDDLE FINGERS are extended. With eyes still closed, Rayburn mouths 'fuck you'. Manzano bursts a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: INTERROGATION ROOM TWO
dialogues.text: Rayburn opens his eyes, looks over as Manzano enters. Still eating, he hands Rayburn a second plate of chicken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pollo Pibil. Chicken and chorizo sausage. Hmmmh. They marinate it in lemon and orange juice. It's a stew really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sets it down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already ate. Manzano enjoys another bite, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about your friend Creasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just said it. He's my friend. Nothing else to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read the file. You and Creasy have seen quite a bit together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two tourists who never went home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You helped him get this job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what friends do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. But if I traced Creasy to you, others will do it as well. Their facilities are as good as my own, if not better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can take care of myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and Creasy both. A two man army according to Interpol. Panama. Lebanon with the Druze. Desert Storm. Where you were contracted by the U.S. Army to hunt down elite Iraqi military commanders. (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two were a married couple. Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kind that gets divorced, but still stay friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to him?   What happened to Creasy? Rayburn flinches at some bitter memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of your business. Or mine for that matter. I got nothing more to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my jurisdiction. I want these men as much as Creasy does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll deliver more justice in a weekend, than ten years of your courts and tribunals. So stay out of his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I plan to. I'll even help him if I can. He's going to lead me to the 'The Dreamer'. Someone I want very badly. But I'd like to understand him. Give me that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinta Martin Ramos is just a number to you. Tragic, a public outcry, but a number. One more dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was she to Creasy then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Light. At the end of a long, dark tunnel. Somehow, she showed him it was alright to live again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they took that away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man can be an artist in anything. Stone, paint, words. Food. Anything if his soul is true to it. Creasy's art is death. And he's about to paint his masterpiece. The words sink in.   Manzano understands their magnitude. Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? I got Jap businessmen to drive across the border. So, if you'll do me a favor and let me the fuck out of here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Framed commendations fall to the carpet as Rosanna slams up against the wall of Manzano's office. Skirt up around her waist, Manzano moves inside of her. Between breaths:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it true? Creasy saved the little girl that was kidnapped yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And left three more dead men. She bites the heel of his palm to keep from crying out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you talked to him, did he look sane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not by the rules of polite society at least.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he's... magnificent. As they both climax, pressed up hard against each other...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You only fuck me to get information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You only give information so you can fuck me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful circle. He kisses her, turned on again already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's put Creasy to press. There's a vigilante cleaning up Mexico. An unstoppable hero. As Manzano considers this, likes it, Rosanna takes the ATM card out from her bra. Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as long as we're talking information, there's something else as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he takes card)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should start going for your tits first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Underwater as Pinta swims. As she spins, kicks off the wall, it's Creasy who comes out the other side. A plume of red blossoming off his side. This is done over and over, faster and faster, closer and closer. The blood becomes darker, bigger. And we push into that blood until it's finally obscuring everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A row of newspapers being set out.     Creasy's face on t front page of every one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quaint old Mexico neighborhood. We follow a long canvas bag being carried through the streets. Carried by Creasy. Toward the end of the street and a ground floor apartment. Walks past a canary yellow Coup deVille, which has seen better days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An elderly couple eating lunch. The HUSBAND looks over at a knock on the door. He stands, answers it. Creasy slides in, eases the door shut behind him. Gun in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not here to hurt you. I need to borrow your house and your car. Are you the proud owners of the Coupe deVille?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A military operation as Tazinari is led out to his car. Two heavy gray sedans wait. Tazinari gets in the back of the second car with his AIDE-DE-CAMP. The door is shut behind them.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: The door closes with an hermetic whump. The two cars pull away toward the opening FRONT GATES. Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creasy has just finished taping the old couple to two chairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you promise to speak softly and not to shout, I won't have to tape your mouths. The old man looks to his wife, then back to Creasy. Nods. The old man watches as Creasy opens he canvas bag, pulls out two metal tubes that he screws together. It's a ROCKET LAUNCHER. Next he pulls out a cone-shaped missile. The old man is starting to look curious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know you have a dishonest policeman living in your neighborhood? Creasy depresses the fins on the missile and slides it back into the tube.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know of you. You're the American. The bodyguard who's killing the kidnapper. Creasy doesn't answer, steps into the center of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the church, they say to forgive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgiveness is between them and God. It's my job to arrange the meeting. Creasy looks back and forth between two shuttered windows and in a line to the wall with a household Catholic alter. Christ on the cross sits front and center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have an old blanket you don't care about? I don't want to burn that wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A figure rises, framed in the window. And Pinta stands beside him.   As she puts her fingers in her ears... Creasy looks back over his shoulder, but of course she's not there. Work in Progress 2/10/03 Creasy fires the rocket launcher. A gout of flame erupts from the back. But Creasy has hung a blanket on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyes widening as the first rocket streaks toward them. The driver stands on the brakes. The car explodes, is obliterated really, from the inside out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tazinari's car slams into the debris of the lead car and slides sideways against a wall wedging it in. Real tight.

dialogues.speaker: CREASY
dialogues.text: A 'Man On Fire' strides through the smoke and dust. A shotgun at his side and a Molotov cocktail in his left hand. Without missing  a stride he unloads both barrels into th drivers window.   A scary prospect even though it's bulle proof. The lit   Molotov explodes beneath the car. Silence. Then a   dull impact explosion. 30 feet of flames envelope  the car. The driver and Tazinari both prisoners inside  their own car. The driver exits releasing a full clip from his Uzi. Creasy nails him with a single shot to the head. Tazinari exits through the flames hands high in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There sits the canary yellow Coupe deVille. Eyes and mouth taped shut, hands and ankles bound by flex-cuffs. Tazinari stands there. Creasy steps up, pulls the tape off Tazinari's eyes. looks about, relatively calm considering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know where you are? As Tazinari tries to process... Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the bridge. Where the deal went south. Now why don't you tell me what went down? Creasy tears the tape off his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know who I am? I am the commandante of the Judicial anti- kidnapping division.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And one of the founding members of La Hermanidad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Correct! Creasy pulls the buck knife from his pocket, flips  it open. As Tazinari reacts, Creasy spins him round,   slits his clothes up from ankle to neck. The cloth drops   away some hanging at Tazinari's wrists. Tazinari has a   sudde loss of attitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close up: Tazinari hands being cuff flexed and tied to side view mirrors of the Coupe deVille. Cut back to see Tazinari, naked other than his Calvin Klein skivvies, spread-eagled across the grill of the car, butt forward (Reminiscent of 'the woods scene' in

dialogues.speaker: DELIVERANCE
dialogues.text: Creasy rips down his Calvins. CU of Tazinari's face winces with either pain or extreme discomfort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not my dick. That's the barrel of your own gun. Shoved up your own ass. As Tazinari reacts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .44 Magnum. Now, how's your hearing? We hear the CLICK of the trigger being cocked back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, don't... Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all up to you, commandante.    Tell me about you and 'The Dreamer'. Creasy puts a tape recorder on the hood and presses the record button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know him. I saw the opportunity and got lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky how?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That he used policemen. That you killed them, it made it a police matter. The Ramos family couldn't refuse our involvement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I had my men ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stole the drop. MORE FLASHES: As we see this happen. POV from opposite side of the bridge. POV from the drop car. See the money drop get ambushed by unknown faces. 'The nephew' gets shot. The kidnapper running the show sounds like Woody Woodpecker, high pitched squeaky voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You done it before? Tazinari doesn't answer.   Creasy gives the Magnum a tweak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.   Many times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O.K.   So tell me more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was no ten million dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ransom was ten. Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two and a half. That's how much there was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't lie to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two and a half! The rest was paper! Strips of paper! FLASHBACK:   Tazinari, in his office, sifting through the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe your men stole from you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Whoever took the rest took it before the exchange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who gave the bags to Ramos?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His lawyer.   Jordan Kalfus. FLASHBACK: Ramos House. Bags of cash being switched from the Mercedes with the flat tire to the 2nd Mercedes in the garage. See that Jordan does the switch, four bags on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Creasy thinks.   Tazinari has been stretched to his limit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all I know! Please. I'm sorry for the girl. But it was business! I'm a professional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what everybody keeps saying. Creasy switches off the tape recorder and pockets it. Relief for Tazinari as the .44 Is withdrawn. Creasy walks around the car Tazinari now looking like a naked hood ornament. Butt first. Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Average speed 80 m.p.h. This is Mexico. Creasy slips the clutch, jumps out, and the Coup deVille kangaroos forward down the ramp. Gathering momentum into the oncoming traffic. Tazinari screams right on impact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flambouyant, beautiful 16-year-old boy with a black eye and bloody nose. Jordan's boyfriend. Terrified and in tears runs down the hallway. Creasy following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge maroon cloud covers the center of the pool. In the middle of the cloud is Jordan face down floating on the surface dressed in his beige linen suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE UP of Jordan face down. We glimpse what we don't want to see. Black holes where his eyes and mouth were. His ears missing. Creasy not terribly impressed.   Just pissed that he's late. Creasy on a cell phone talking to Rosanna

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another favor... get me banking info on Jordan Kalfus. U.S. deposits or withdrawals. Thanks. Oh, get me the same on Samuel Ramos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I contact you?   We still don't have the ATM info.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't, I'll call you. Oh! I have a tape recording that I am sure will interest you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creasy doing laps. He swims the last few meters underwater. As he surfaces, Pinta waits by the edge. She nods in grim satisfaction. Work in Progress 2/10/03 He isn't doing well. The cloud of deep red emanating from his stomach envelopes his whole body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samuel eats dinner silently. Lisa just stares into space, nursing a vodka. Even great marriages cannot survive the trauma of kidnapping and subsequent death. The door opens and they expect to see Maria with the deserts. Creasy enters and sits at the table like a dinner guest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Samuel)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to talk to your wife. If you move or say one word, I'll kill you. He takes a Colt Officer model .45 semi-automatic pistol out of his waistband and lays it on the table in preparation for something, we don't know what. He turns to Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to tell you a story. Your lawyer is dead. Someone didn't want him talking. Last week he wired $2.5 million into his U.S. bank account. Colonel Ernesto Tazinari is also dead. He hijacked the ransom drop, another $2.5 million. If my arithmetic is correct it means $5 million remains. Creasy looks to Samuel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your husband magically had five million deposited in a U.S. bank account last Friday. Lisa's eyes never leave Creasy's...trying to discern whether this is true or not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They planned it, Samuel and Kalfus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Planned what? Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An autosequestra. Kalfus arranged for Pinta to be taken to a safehouse. I'm sure he thought she'd sit there for three days eating pizza and watching TV. It didn't work out that way. Everything got fucked up when I killed the cops and Tazinari saw an opportunity. Lisa screams.   Creasy gestures with a finger to his lips

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
