dialogues.text: On the surface it was low risk and high return. This was the third autosequestra Jordan had organized for clients. The other two succeeded. Samuel looks to Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our lifestyle was in jeopardy. My pain and weakness only fueled your anger and determination. I wasn't sure about whether to go through with it or not. Then I woke up one day and it was done. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan was supposed to take care of it. Through all of the above, Creasy removes the special bullet held in the seam of his wallet. The misfire.     H empties the other cartridges from his gun. Lisa suddenly attacks Samuel in a violent, emotional outburst of tears, screaming, and rage. Drawing blood from his nose and upper lip. Samuel smothers Lisa's arms beneath his. He appears strong and decisive for the first time. Creasy very carefully takes the bullet, puts it into the magazine and chambers the round. He looks into Samuel's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bullet does not lie. A bullet tells the truth. And the truth will set you free. Creasy hands Samuel the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In many ways I think this bullet should be shared between you and Lisa. Work in Progress 2/10/03 Creasy exits the room. Samuel kisses Lisa on the forehead and exits onto the terrace. A GUNSHOT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa just sits.    Where will she find air to breathe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life moves on with its brutal inevitability.    This is a river whose course cannot be altered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the backseat I can see   Creasy's eyes in the mirror. He watches    and thinks. He never smiles. I wish I    was back in the front seat with him. I    wish he would smile. Creasy looks up from the notebook and out at the city. And a smile comes. But it's bitter and hopeless. It's half grief, half not knowing where to go next, what to do. And he's dying. He knows that too. Creasy dials a number on a cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hola...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creasy.

dialogues.speaker: ROSANNA
dialogues.text: Inside somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I traced the PIN. I have an address for you. But I need to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I show, you give me the information?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where? Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back on Rosanna. We see she's sitting in the AFI Operations Center amongst Technicians, surveillance and listening devices, and Manzano. We can hear the interior of a family house, kids, a frustrated mother, a Mexican soap playing in the B.G., over speakers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Manzano)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got the whole place wiretapped. But no males that sound anything like 'The Dreamer'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll show. Manzano is carrying a 8" X 10" digital blow up of a handsome Mexican John Gotti type in some nightclub environment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's the man, 'the Boss?' My guys got into the house on the pretext of giving cholera shots. We had to inject the whole Barrio. We bugged the house and stole the picture of him. Manzano looks at Rosanna. Now's the time to really pressure him. Lets publish his picture in tomorrow's edition. Rosanna understands the consequences makes light of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how are going to recipricate? Manzano discreetly slides his hands up her crotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her car draws up. Her driver exits and opens her door. She steps out. But waiting inside is a welcoming committee. A HOODED FIGURE wielding a shotgun who shoots the driver in both knees. Work in Progress 2/10/03 HOODED FIGURE waves the shotgun under Rosanna's nose. A warning. Then disappears into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosanna in her apartment in the dark.     A tear trails h cheek. CU of the proofsheet of the next day's newspaper.     The Boss' picture, full frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creasy moves in the shadows looking remarkably strong considering his wounds.

dialogues.speaker: CREASY
dialogues.text: Cameras whirring. Video being shot.     He hasn't arrived alone. As he disappears inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The OWNER watches nervously as   Creasy approaches wearin a wool CAP. A pale attempt at    disguising his identity. There's a newspaper folded on   his dais, more photos of Creasy, his dead targets, the   story of his vendetta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for Rosanna Guerrero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way. Empty restaurant, chairs  on tables. An    exterior streetlight illuminates  the darkness.    The owner leads him down a row of empty  booths. Creasy    slows, stops a he sees the only person  waiting for him   is Manzano. As Manzano smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holds up paper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hombre en fuego. Man On Fire. That's what the papers have named you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's what you and Rosanna named me. Right? Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit, Creasy. Everything that happens from now on does so with my permission. (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really. You won't find a better carne asada in all of Mexico. The table is covered in an arrangement of the best food you will ever find in Mexico. Creasy sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs at himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last few days may represent the best police work of my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same thing as you. Except, my reach isn't as long as yours. My father was a policemen, did you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know shit about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was one of the original founders of 'Le Hermanidad' in the days when it represented good not evil. Manzano smiles; he likes Creasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was murdered. And now here I am. Trying to honor his memory. Hamstrung by bureaucracy and corruption. The organization that he began now protects criminals at the highest level where I would need a Presidential finding in order to expose it...or you. The WAITER steps over; Manzano waves him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My family lives in Miami.   Because of the death threats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not worth it. Be with them instead. Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It galls me to watch you. You can do as much in days as I can in years. Men like the 'The Dreamer' are protected. Out of everyone's grasp it seems, but yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to arrest me or talk me to death? Manzano laughs again.   Genuine.   Creasy cracks him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My country needs justice. Proper justice. Gunning men down in the street only feeds the violence. They need to be brought to trial. Dealt with properly. Then people will respect the law. When they see it works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you are going to talk me to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You walk out and deal justice. You're what I wish I could be. (another laugh, then a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The policemen who kills you, his family will have all they want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I hope the one who gets me has got lots of kids. What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to arrest you for murder! I want to shake your hand and reload your gun! I want to kill my pride and give you my blessing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My deal is with Rosanna. I knew you guys were up to something. Are you two fucking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but I have to admit I thought about it. CREASY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liar. Just tell me who the bank card belongs to. Name and address. Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no interest in making things easy, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not... easy. Manzano reaches into his pocket. He pulls out a folded PIECE OF PAPER and a PRESCRIPTION BOTTLE. He hands the bottle out first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percodan.   I imagine you need handfuls by now. Creasy makes no move to take it. Manzano sighs, sets it down in front of him. Regarding the paper...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Account belongs to a woman we think is The Dreamer's girlfriend. Reina Rosas, who is 8 months pregnant. Creasy holds his hand out.     Manzano hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plan is the girlfriend will lead you to the Boss. You'll lead me, and I'll arrest him. Agreed? Creasy doesn't respond. Finally Manzano gives him the paper, a mimeographed mugshot, and address scrawled on it Creasy stands. As he scoops up the pills. Creasy starts out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creasy... (Creasy turns)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd have liked to have known you under different circumstances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off the top of my head, I don't know what they could've been. As Creasy departs...

dialogues.speaker: BLACK SCREEN
dialogues.text: Work in Progress 2/10/03

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romans chapter 13:4 - therefore whoever resists authority will bring judgment on themselves. Now it is time to awake out of sleep for our salvation is nearer than we first believed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
